alert.note: Alert for Denton (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued April 25 at 12:23AM CDT by NWS Dallas-Fort Worth
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 330 AM CDT EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of north central Texas, including the following counties, Denton and Wise. * WHEN...Until 330 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will likely cause urban and small stream flooding. Low lying and/or poor drainage areas will experience minor flooding in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Plano, Frisco, Denton, Lewisville, Flower Mound, The Colony, Corinth, Highland Village, Lake Dallas, Sanger, Decatur, Bridgeport, Briar, Lake Lewisville, Little Elm, Krum, Pilot Point, Argyle, Hickory Creek and Justin.
